item.title: Intro to Recurrent Neural Networks
item.description: Why the need for a different model paradigm? Types of sequences modeling RNN modeling

item.title: About Me
item.description: Background My background is in theoretical condensed matter and quantum physics. I graduated in 2023 from ETH Zurich. I conducted my research in the Materials Theory Group under Prof. Nicola Spaldin. I joined initially in Fall 2022 to work on the behaviour of polar metals, an unusual and even contraindicated combination that leads to some exotic physics. There as a student researcher, I performed electronic structure calculations based on density functional theory and constructed physical Hamiltonian models to demonstrate that two phenomena, the kinetic magnetoelectric effect and the non-linear Hall effect, are universal to polar metals.
